page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN FORTHAMPTON
page.content: The main source of local employment within this block is farming but farmers and farm labourers no longer make up the bulk of the working population. 15 villagers still find employment within the village of Forthampton but the majority of the people now commute four miles to Tewkesbury to work in factories and offices. There is one gentleman who commutes daily to London and there is also a Gloucester bank manager and a judge who live in the village Only two people are now employed at Forthampton Court, the local manor house, which uses contract labour in place of a large permanent staff. The block is becoming increasingly dominated by retired people who have either lived there all their lives or have moved to enjoy the peace and quiet of this rural area.
